  "description": "Emmittex Agro Industry Limited (Palm Kernel Oil Mills Division) came into existence with a mission to provide clean and pure&nbsp;indigenous crude palm kernel oil (CPKO) to our teeming Nigerians. The success of this objective is largely in your hands. It is only through your disciplined, efficient, devoted and loyal hard work that you can boost the health of the company and consequently, your own careers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Akwuzu, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Accountant
Industry: Agriculture / Agro-Processing

Description


	Our fast-growing agro-producing company is seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented&nbsp;Account Officer&nbsp;to support daily financial operations.
	The ideal candidate will have experience working in a production or manufacturing environment, where attention to cost tracking, inventory reconciliation, and financial accuracy is essential.
	This position plays a key role in ensuring proper documentation, accurate record-keeping, and timely financial reporting.


Key Responsibilities
Daily Financial Operations:


	The Account Officer will record financial transactions, update ledgers, post entries into accounting systems, and ensure proper filing of invoices, receipts, payment vouchers, and other documentation.
	They will assist the Accountant with analyzing financial information and preparing daily, weekly, and monthly reports.


Accounts Payable &amp; Receivable Management:


	The role includes managing supplier and customer accounts, preparing payment schedules, processing approved payments, raising invoices, issuing receipts, reconciling balances, and ensuring proper follow-up on outstanding amounts.


Banking &amp; Reconciliation:


	The Account Officer will assist with preparing bank deposit slips, ensuring timely lodgment of cash and cheques, conducting daily bank reconciliations, and reporting discrepancies promptly.


Inventory &amp; Cost Support (Production Environment):


	Working closely with the store and production teams, the Account Officer will help track raw material usage, reconcile stock records, monitor variances, and support cost control efforts.
	The individual must be able to verify stock movement documents, purchase records, and production consumption sheets.


Payroll &amp; Staff Expenses Support:


	They will assist in preparing payroll schedules, verifying attendance sheets, reviewing expense claims, and ensuring proper approval and documentation.


Financial Reporting &amp; Compliance:


	The role supports the preparation of compliance documents, tax records, audit schedules, petty cash management, and adherence to company financial policies.
	The officer will maintain an up-to-date filing system for financial documents for audit readiness.


Collaboration &amp; Support:


	The Account Officer works directly under the Accountant but collaborates with procurement, store, operations, and admin teams to ensure proper financial controls and accurate internal reporting.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or related field.
	1 - 3 years of relevant experience, preferably in an agro, production, manufacturing, or FMCG environment.
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, bookkeeping, and reconciliation procedures.
	Proficiency in accounting software (QuickBooks, Sage, or similar).
	Good Excel skills.
	High level of accuracy, confidentiality, and financial discipline.
	Ability to work with minimal supervision and meet deadlines.
	Strong communication and documentation skills.


Salary
N130,000 - N150,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;talent.hunt1@yahoo.com&nbsp;using &#39;&#39;Account Officer &ndash; Agro&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

Account Officer Job at Emmittex Agro Industry Limited




        
    

        
        Emmittex Agro Industry Limited (Palm Kernel Oil Mills Division) came into existence with a mission to provide clean and pure indigenous crude palm kernel oil (CPKO) to our teeming Nigerians. The success of this objective is largely in your hands. It is only through your disciplined, efficient, devoted and loyal hard work that you can boost the health of the company and consequently, your own careers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location: Akwuzu, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Accountant
Industry: Agriculture / Agro-Processing

Description
     

            
    




	Our fast-growing agro-producing company is seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Account Officer to support daily financial operations.
	The ideal candidate will have experience working in a production or manufacturing environment, where attention to cost tracking, inventory reconciliation, and financial accuracy is essential.
	This position plays a key role in ensuring proper documentation, accurate record-keeping, and timely financial reporting.


Key Responsibilities
Daily Financial Operations:


	The Account Officer will record financial transactions, update ledgers, post entries into accounting systems, and ensure proper filing of invoices, receipts, payment vouchers, and other documentation.
	They will assist the Accountant with analyzing financial information and preparing daily, weekly, and monthly reports.


Accounts Payable & Receivable Management:


	The role includes managing supplier and customer accounts, preparing payment schedules, processing approved payments, raising invoices, issuing receipts, reconciling balances, and ensuring proper follow-up on outstanding amounts.


Banking & Reconciliation:


	The Account Officer will assist with preparing bank deposit slips, ensuring timely lodgment of cash and cheques, conducting daily bank reconciliations, and reporting discrepancies promptly.


Inventory & Cost Support (Production Environment):


	Working closely with the store and production teams, the Account Officer will help track raw material usage, reconcile stock records, monitor variances, and support cost control efforts.
	The individual must be able to verify stock movement documents, purchase records, and production consumption sheets.


Payroll & Staff Expenses Support:


	They will assist in preparing payroll schedules, verifying attendance sheets, reviewing expense claims, and ensuring proper approval and documentation.


Financial Reporting & Compliance:


	The role supports the preparation of compliance documents, tax records, audit schedules, petty cash management, and adherence to company financial policies.
	The officer will maintain an up-to-date filing system for financial documents for audit readiness.


Collaboration & Support:


	The Account Officer works directly under the Accountant but collaborates with procurement, store, operations, and admin teams to ensure proper financial controls and accurate internal reporting.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or related field.
	1 - 3 years of relevant experience, preferably in an agro, production, manufacturing, or FMCG environment.
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, bookkeeping, and reconciliation procedures.
	Proficiency in accounting software (QuickBooks, Sage, or similar).
	Good Excel skills.
	High level of accuracy, confidentiality, and financial discipline.
	Ability to work with minimal supervision and meet deadlines.
	Strong communication and documentation skills.


Salary
N130,000 - N150,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talent.hunt1@yahoo.com using ''Account Officer – Agro" as the subject of the mail.

Site Engineer Job at Efficacy Development Plc




        
    

        
        Efficacy Development PLC is a top real estate company in Nigeria, celebrated for unwavering commitment to delivering exceptional properties. As a renowned real estate development company located in Lagos, With a rich history spanning seventeen years, we have not only transformed skylines but also lives, leaving a lasting mark on the real estate landscape.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Site Engineer

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	Coordination of and supervision of workers.
	Provide schedules for workers.
	Supervise the Contractor’s work and assign tasks to construction workers.
	Liaise with contractors, managers and other stakeholders, ensuring that all parties remain coordinated.
	Organising the equipment and manpower necessary to complete the project.
	Responsible for maintaining safety and quality standards.
	Keeping detailed records of construction site activities.
	Undertaking technical and feasibility studies, including site investigations.
	Resolving design and development problems.


Job Requirements


	B.Sc. Degree / HND in Civil Engineering.
	3 years of work experience in Civil Engineering / Construction.
	Excellent knowledge of vast structural design and visualisation software such as AutoCAD, Civil 3D or similar, Orion, etc.
	Proficiency in site layout, grading, utility design, erosion control, regulatory approvals, etc.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Resides within the Ibeju-Lekki axis.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to  careers@efficacyconstruction.com using the Job Positioas the subject of the email.
